title: Patel and F.B.I. Face Scrutiny as Kirk’s Killer Remains at Large
summary: Already, a series of missteps by Kash Patel, the F.B.I. director, in recent months have invited worries that he has eroded public confidence in the agency.

title: After Charlie Kirk’s Death, Voters Agree Something Is Wrong in US
summary: In interviews from across the country, people expressed fear and wariness, and said that the country seemed to be spinning out of control.

title: The Last Person to Question Charlie Kirk
summary: Millions of people saw the brief exchange between the right-wing political activist and a liberal TikToker after footage of the assassination spread like wildfire across social media.

title: F.B.I. Faces Growing Scrutiny as Kirk Manhunt Continues, and the Fight Over Nonstick Pans
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Breaking Precedent, G.O.P. Changes Rules on Nominees
summary: Senate Republicans used what is known as the nuclear option to break a Democratic blockade of President Trump’s nominees, weakening Congress’s vetting role.

title: Hyundai ICE Raid Detained Workers With Short-Term Business Visas
summary: Last week’s immigration operation at a battery plant highlighted a tactic that companies use to bring in foreign workers to establish new operations.

title: Europe’s 3 Top Leaders Are Striding on the World Stage but Stumbling at Home
summary: The foreign policy successes of Keir Starmer of Britain, Emmanuel Macron of France and Friedrich Merz of Germany are in contrast with their dismal domestic performances.

title: In ‘Spinal Tap’ and Its Sequel, Rock Fact and Fiction Happily Blur
summary: Initially drawing from real life, the director Rob Reiner and his cast found that actual bands experienced moments from their work.

title: ‘Spinal Tap II: The End Continues’ Review: They Can’t Leave This Behind
summary: Four decades after their big-screen hit, the rock legends David, Derek and Nigel have reunited for one final (really, truly) concert.

title: A Defender of Darkness in the Darkest Place on Earth
summary: A Chilean astronomer has become dedicated to battling light pollution in the Atacama Desert and preserve what is considered the best place on Earth to study space.

title: Voucher Push Is Reshaping Private School Education, Study Finds
summary: Vouchers are spurring the growth of low-priced, Christian schools that often serve small populations of students. They’re also pushing up tuition prices.

title: Natalie Massenet and Erik Torstensson’s Messy Split, in Dueling Lawsuits
summary: In the messy, public split of the Net-a-Porter founder Natalie Massenet and Erik Torstensson, no accusations seem off limits.

title: A.I.’s Prophet of Doom Wants to Shut It All Down
summary: Eliezer Yudkowsky has spent the past 20 years warning A.I. insiders of danger. Now, he’s making his case to the public.

title: An Annual Blast of Pacific Cold Water Did Not Occur, Alarming Scientists
summary: The cold water upswell, which is vital to marine life, did not materialize for the first time on record. Researchers are trying to figure out why.

title: In the Pacific, Unkept U.S. Promises on Climate Cut Deep
summary: Pacific island nations have seen American pledges and attention come and go with geopolitical winds. Recent U.S. pullbacks are met with disappointment but not surprise.

title: Fords, Tank 500s and a New Hospital: The Influence Campaigns in the Pacific
summary: All around Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands and host of a regional summit, are not-so-subtle hints of donor nations competing for hearts and minds.

title: With ‘I Love L.A.,’ Rachel Sennott Keeps Her Cool
summary: The comic and actor became an indie darling in films like “Shiva Baby” and “Bottoms.” “I Love L.A.,” an HBO comedy premiering in November, is her first project as a solo creator.

title: What MAGA Lost When It Lost Charlie Kirk
summary: His death makes it harder to look ahead and glimpse what MAGA will stand for.

title: How Charlie Kirk Remade Campus Conservatism
summary: He was a spokesman for a movement that seemed both more rebellious and more normal.

title: Late Night Calls for Bringing the Political Temperature Down
summary: Seth Meyers and other hosts talked about Charlie Kirk’s assassination, denouncing political violence and incendiary rhetoric.

title: Rare but Serious Complication Shows Flu’s Potential Harm
summary: Acute necrotizing encephalopathy, or A.N.E., can result from influenza or other infections, including Covid-19.

title: A False Report of a Shooter Prompts Gunfire and Injuries at the U.S. Naval Academy
summary: A midshipman and a law enforcement officer were injured in an altercation after misinformation spread at the campus in Annapolis, Md., at a moment of heightened tension nationwide.

title: Suspect in Murder of Queens Couple Told Police That He Burned Them
summary: Jamel McGriff, who was arraigned late Thursday night, told the authorities that he had “molested” the septuagenarians before torching their home in the Bellerose neighborhood.

title: Bolsonaro Convicted of Attempting a Coup in Brazil, Sentenced to 27 Years in Prison
summary: Brazil’s Supreme Court convicted the former president of trying to cling to power after losing the 2022 election, including a plan to assassinate his opponent.
